body:
Hi, 

It looks like you are trying to load depth modality model into RGB modality model. But you seems to have the parameters right. 
Can you please send your bash file `run_online.sh`  and model.py ? 
PS: Please use ``` before and after any code and output for easiness of reading.

I didnt change anything in model.py
content of run_online.sh
`#!/bin/bash
python online_test.py \
	--root_path /home/sanaz/Documents/projects/hand-guesture/\
	--video_path  /home/sanaz/Documents/projects/hand-guesture/video/video.mp4 \
	--annotation_path /home/sanaz/Documents/projects/hand-guesture/annotation_EgoGesture/egogestureall.json \
	--resume_path_det /home/sanaz/Documents/projects/hand-guesture/egogesture_resnetl_10_Depth_8.pth \
	--resume_path_clf /home/sanaz/Documents/projects/hand-guesture/egogesture_resnext_101_Depth_32.pth  \
	--result_path /home/sanaz/Documents/projects/hand-guesture/results \
	--dataset egogesture    \
	--sample_duration_det 8 \
	--sample_duration_clf 32 \
	--model_det resnetl \
	--model_clf resnext \
	--model_depth_det 10 \
	--model_depth_clf 101 \
	--resnet_shortcut_det A \
	--resnet_shortcut_clf B \
	--batch_size 1 \
	--n_classes_det 2 \
	--n_finetune_classes_det 2 \
	--n_classes_clf 83 \
	--n_finetune_classes_clf 83 \
	--n_threads 16 \
	--checkpoint 1 \
	--modality_det Depth \
	--modality_clf Depth \
	--n_val_samples 1 \
	--train_crop random \
	--test_subset test  \
	--det_strategy median \
	--det_queue_size 4 \
	--det_counter 2 \
	--clf_strategy median \
	--clf_queue_size 16 \
	--clf_threshold_pre 0.6 \
	--clf_threshold_final 0.15 \
	--stride_len 1 \
    --pretrain_path_det /home/sanaz/Documents/projects/hand-guesture/egogesture_resnetl_10_Depth_8.pth \
    --pretrain_path_clf /home/sanaz/Documents/projects/hand-guesture/egogesture_resnext_101_Depth_32.pth


`

I see that you have the path configuration wrong. Please see the path concatenation in the `online_test.py` file as following :
```python
if opt.root_path != '':
    opt.video_path = os.path.join(opt.root_path, opt.video_path)
    opt.annotation_path = os.path.join(opt.root_path, opt.annotation_path)
    opt.result_path = os.path.join(opt.root_path, opt.result_path)
    if opt.resume_path:
        opt.resume_path = os.path.join(opt.root_path, opt.resume_path)
    if opt.pretrain_path:
        opt.pretrain_path = os.path.join(opt.root_path, opt.pretrain_path)
```
So your configuration for these above parameters can be as following : 
```bash
--root_path /home/sanaz/Documents/projects/hand-guesture/
--video_path video/video.mp4
--annotation_path annotation_EgoGesture/egogestureall.json
--resume_path_det egogesture_resnetl_10_Depth_8.pth
--resume_path_clf egogesture_resnext_101_Depth_32.pth
--result_path results 
```
Also, yo used a .mp4 file for video path. The naming may be confusing here. `video_path` actually need to be the root path to the dataset. Under this path, each folder corresponds a sample video and under each sample the frames for the corresponding video is extracted. Please see Egogesture Dataset for this. If you want to test the code on your own video then it means you need to extract frames first and write a new dataset.py function for this dataset like egogesture_onlin.py
Hi @sanaz97 , do you ave any update regarding the issue?

Hi..my last problem was solved but i faced to new problem :(
I ran `online_test.py` and it don't have any error and build 2 json files:

`Opt_clf.json`
`Opt_det.json`

but, how can I run it in webcam mode to test it in realtime?
the output is as follows below

        (relu): ReLU(inplace)
      )
    )

        (conv2): Conv3d(256, 256, kernel_size=(3, 3, 3), stride=(2, 2, 2), padding=(1, 1, 1), groups=32, bias=False)
        (bn2): BatchNorm3d(256, eps=1e-05, momentum=0.1, affine=True, track_running_stats=True)
        (conv3): Conv3d(256, 512, kernel_size=(1, 1, 1), stride=(1, 1, 1), bias=False)
        (bn3): BatchNorm3d(512, eps=1e-05, momentum=0.1, affine=True, track_running_stats=True)
        (relu): ReLU(inplace)
        (downsample): Sequential(
          (0): Conv3d(256, 512, kernel_size=(1, 1, 1), stride=(2, 2, 2), bias=False)
          (1): BatchNorm3d(512, eps=1e-05, momentum=0.1, affine=True, track_running_stats=True)
        )
      )

        (conv1): Conv3d(512, 256, kernel_size=(1, 1, 1), stride=(1, 1, 1), bias=False)

        (conv2): Conv3d(256, 256, kernel_size=(3, 3, 3), stride=(1, 1, 1), padding=(1, 1, 1), groups=32, bias=False)

        (conv3): Conv3d(256, 512, kernel_size=(1, 1, 1), stride=(1, 1, 1), bias=False)
        (bn3): BatchNorm3d(512, eps=1e-05, momentum=0.1, affine=True, track_running_stats=True)
        (relu): ReLU(inplace)

        (conv1): Conv3d(512, 256, kernel_size=(1, 1, 1), stride=(1, 1, 1), bias=False)
        (bn1): BatchNorm3d(256, eps=1e-05, momentum=0.1, affine=True, track_running_stats=True)
        (conv2): Conv3d(256, 256, kernel_size=(3, 3, 3), stride=(1, 1, 1), padding=(1, 1, 1), groups=32, bias=False)
        (bn2): BatchNorm3d(256, eps=1e-05, momentum=0.1, affine=True, track_running_stats=True)
        (conv3): Conv3d(256, 512, kernel_size=(1, 1, 1), stride=(1, 1, 1), bias=False)
        (bn3): BatchNorm3d(512, eps=1e-05, momentum=0.1, affine=True, track_running_stats=True)
        (relu): ReLU(inplace)
      )
      (3): ResNeXtBottleneck(
        (conv1): Conv3d(512, 256, kernel_size=(1, 1, 1), stride=(1, 1, 1), bias=False)
        (bn1): BatchNorm3d(256, eps=1e-05, momentum=0.1, affine=True, track_running_stats=True)
        (conv2): Conv3d(256, 256, kernel_size=(3, 3, 3), stride=(1, 1, 1), padding=(1, 1, 1), groups=32, bias=False)
        (bn2): BatchNorm3d(256, eps=1e-05, momentum=0.1, affine=True, track_running_stats=True)
        (conv3): Conv3d(256, 512, kernel_size=(1, 1, 1), stride=(1, 1, 1), bias=False)
        (bn3): BatchNorm3d(512, eps=1e-05, momentum=0.1, affine=True, track_running_stats=True)
        (relu): ReLU(inplace)
      )
    )

      (0): ResNeXtBottleneck(
        (conv1): Conv3d(512, 512, kernel_size=(1, 1, 1), stride=(1, 1, 1), bias=False)
        (bn1): BatchNorm3d(512, eps=1e-05, momentum=0.1, affine=True, track_running_stats=True)
        (conv2): Conv3d(512, 512, kernel_size=(3, 3, 3), stride=(2, 2, 2), padding=(1, 1, 1), groups=32, bias=False)
        (bn2): BatchNorm3d(512, eps=1e-05, momentum=0.1, affine=True, track_running_stats=True)
        (conv3): Conv3d(512, 1024, kernel_size=(1, 1, 1), stride=(1, 1, 1), bias=False)
        (bn3): BatchNorm3d(1024, eps=1e-05, momentum=0.1, affine=True, track_running_stats=True)
        (relu): ReLU(inplace)
        (downsample): Sequential(
          (0): Conv3d(512, 1024, kernel_size=(1, 1, 1), stride=(2, 2, 2), bias=False)
          (1): BatchNorm3d(1024, eps=1e-05, momentum=0.1, affine=True, track_running_stats=True)
        )
      )
      (1): ResNeXtBottleneck(
        (conv1): Conv3d(1024, 512, kernel_size=(1, 1, 1), stride=(1, 1, 1), bias=False)
        (bn1): BatchNorm3d(512, eps=1e-05, momentum=0.1, affine=True, track_running_stats=True)
        (conv2): Conv3d(512, 512, kernel_size=(3, 3, 3), stride=(1, 1, 1), padding=(1, 1, 1), groups=32, bias=False)
        (bn2): BatchNorm3d(512, eps=1e-05, momentum=0.1, affine=True, track_running_stats=True)
        (conv3): Conv3d(512, 1024, kernel_size=(1, 1, 1), stride=(1, 1, 1), bias=False)
        (bn3): BatchNorm3d(1024, eps=1e-05, momentum=0.1, affine=True, track_running_stats=True)
        (relu): ReLU(inplace)
      )
      (2): ResNeXtBottleneck(
        (conv1): Conv3d(1024, 512, kernel_size=(1, 1, 1), stride=(1, 1, 1), bias=False)
        (bn1): BatchNorm3d(512, eps=1e-05, momentum=0.1, affine=True, track_running_stats=True)
        (conv2): Conv3d(512, 512, kernel_size=(3, 3, 3), stride=(1, 1, 1), padding=(1, 1, 1), groups=32, bias=False)
        (bn2): BatchNorm3d(512, eps=1e-05, momentum=0.1, affine=True, track_running_stats=True)
        (conv3): Conv3d(512, 1024, kernel_size=(1, 1, 1), stride=(1, 1, 1), bias=False)
        (bn3): BatchNorm3d(1024, eps=1e-05, momentum=0.1, affine=True, track_running_stats=True)
        (relu): ReLU(inplace)
      )
      (3): ResNeXtBottleneck(
        (conv1): Conv3d(1024, 512, kernel_size=(1, 1, 1), stride=(1, 1, 1), bias=False)
        (bn1): BatchNorm3d(512, eps=1e-05, momentum=0.1, affine=True, track_running_stats=True)
        (conv2): Conv3d(512, 512, kernel_size=(3, 3, 3), stride=(1, 1, 1), padding=(1, 1, 1), groups=32, bias=False)
        (bn2): BatchNorm3d(512, eps=1e-05, momentum=0.1, affine=True, track_running_stats=True)
        (conv3): Conv3d(512, 1024, kernel_size=(1, 1, 1), stride=(1, 1, 1), bias=False)
        (bn3): BatchNorm3d(1024, eps=1e-05, momentum=0.1, affine=True, track_running_stats=True)
        (relu): ReLU(inplace)
      )
      (4): ResNeXtBottleneck(
        (conv1): Conv3d(1024, 512, kernel_size=(1, 1, 1), stride=(1, 1, 1), bias=False)
        (bn1): BatchNorm3d(512, eps=1e-05, momentum=0.1, affine=True, track_running_stats=True)
        (conv2): Conv3d(512, 512, kernel_size=(3, 3, 3), stride=(1, 1, 1), padding=(1, 1, 1), groups=32, bias=False)
        (bn2): BatchNorm3d(512, eps=1e-05, momentum=0.1, affine=True, track_running_stats=True)

Great then I am closing this one and creating a new issue for clearance  https://github.com/ahmetgunduz/Real-time-GesRec/issues/17# for that. (like what is your data and what kind of camera do you have etc.) Because doing a real-time test with a camera input is different than what  real-time test mentioned and done here.
